dict.string: Prehospital Provider
• Provides a brief patient report (includes MIVT and AMPLE) • Provides a completed EMS run sheet to emergency department
Emergency Medicine Physician and EM Resident Team

• Assists with primary survey and continues with secondary survey if the trauma attending or chief has not yet arrived for Trauma 1 Team Activations. Performs primary and secondary survey on Trauma 2 Team Activations (TTA), timely consults on Trauma 3. • Assesses airway and breathing • Performs the AMPLE history and assists with secondary survey above the neck
Attending Trauma Surgeon

• Must arrive within 15 minutes for a Trauma 1 Team Activation (TTA) • Supervises/Assists Trauma Chief Resident in performance of primary and secondary survey andin management and resuscitation of patient • Supervises all procedures • Communicates with affiliated services for patient care : Anesthesia and OR charge nurse regarding priority for the OR if applicable, Inteventional Radiology for angioembolization, etc • Communicate with IR for angio/embolization if applicable • Discusses plan of care with team and ensures proper documentation of history and physical exam • Overall assumes primary responsibility for management of patient and dictates level of care for admission
Back Up Trauma Surgeon
• Weekdays: Trauma Rounder Surgeon • Weekends: Emergency General Surgery surgeon
Trauma Chief Resident

• Team leader role in resuscitation process and available for emergent interventions and coordinates the roles/responsibilities of trauma team members including Crowd Control • Determines and ensures appropriate diagnostic tests are ordered and completed • Monitors trauma patient and communicates urgent findings to trauma attending immediately • Determines patient’s dispositions and facilitates timely clearance from trauma bay • Discuss Trauma 2 activations with mid-level resident and communicates plan of care to attending immediately
Midlevel Trauma Resident

• Performs primary and secondary surveys and FAST, assists with procedures and management of patient • Follows up on test results and documents in patient record • Assists in obtaining consults AFTER CLEARING WITH ATTENDING, manages consult and assist with plan of care • Communicates patient assessment and plan for Trauma 2 activations to Trauma Team Leader • Assumes primary responsibility for hemodynamically stable trauma patients until patient is transferred to another phase of care • Responds to Trauma 3 consults within 30 minutes of notification
Trauma Intern/NP

• Responsible for ordering trauma labs and radiological studies via Cerner Trauma Resuscitation order set • Completes Trauma H&P • Ensures TEG is taken to Blood Bank • Requests bed for patient admission and completes Methodist Trauma Admission Order Set
Trauma APP
• Assists interns or assumes responsibilities if no intern present • Assist with procedures as appropriate and directed by the Team leader
Medical Student

• Enters the active provider area only under the instruction of the team captain • Roles may include assistant to active provider, exposure of patient, assisting with the exam, transport of TEG sample and procedures as dictated by the Trauma Team Leader
Primary Nurse/Scribe RN

• Nursing Team Lead for trauma resuscitations • Prepares trauma room before patient arrives ensuring airway equipment is available • Confirms all trauma team members have arrived and signed the trauma flowsheet • Records data on Trauma Flowsheet including vital signs, I&O’s and tetanus booster • Provides guidance and Crowd Control • Discusses with Trauma Team priority for tests, procedures and disposition • Place patient clothing and belongings into a labeled bag that accompanies patient. • Coordinates care with X-ray, CT, and the Forensic Nurse Examiner • Assists in transport and gives detailed report to receiving unit
Secondary Nurse

• Assists with patient movement and initial assessment of airway and breathing, as well as primary and secondary survey • Assists with patient clothing removal and initiation of warming measures • Ensures second peripheral IV access, inserts NG/OG and foley upon direction from the trauma team. Ensures appropriate equipment is available for procedures • Maintain/obtain and monitor all intravenous lines • Obtain fluid resuscitation orders and IV rate from Trauma Team Leader • Ensure a minimum of 2 large bore IVs (14G, 16G)
Emergency Nurse (right)

• Assists with patient movement and attaches monitors to the patient and obtains manual BP • Obtain patient’s temperature and labs when directed by trauma team • Administers ordered medications, including tetanus booster. Draws and labels all RSI medications • Ensures appropriate equipment is available for procedures • Operates Rapid Infuser (Level 1) and prepares blood tubing or rapid infuser for blood products • Attaches patient ID bracelet
Respiratory Therapy

• Assists with intubation and ventilation as indicated, including ventilator management • Monitor end-tidal CO2 and SpO2 and record data on RT record • Monitor serial ABG’s and inform Trauma Team Leader of results • Provides report to critical care respiratory therapist prior to care transition
Emergency Department Radiology

• Responds immediately upon notification of Trauma Activation • Confirms STAT CXR order is entered and prepares for chest X-ray • Obtain radiographic priorities from Trauma Team Leader or designee • Notifies emergency department CT tech ETA to CT
Emergency Medicine Orthopedic/Hand Tech
• Assists with application of splint/traction in trauma bay as directed by the Trauma Team Leader • Provides appropriately sized tourniquets upon request
Emergency Department Constant Care Secretary

• Once notified by ambulance triage about activation status, notifies constant care physician and charge nurse about activation status, ETA, mechanism, vital signs • Notifies respiratory therapist of need for ventilator and room number • Overhead pages the trauma team, Trauma 1 or 2 , adult or pediatric, ETA and room number • Pages all consults for the surgery PGY1 or designated trauma team member and documents time of call back • Assembles and copies all documentation for transfer to destination and makes additional copy for Trauma Services
Chaplain/Emergency Department Social Worker

• Meets family; escorts them to consultation/quiet room and provides support • Assists/collaborates with social worker in the identification of patient • Accompanies physician when making a death notification and provide bereavement care
Emergency Medicine Pharmacist
• Responds to all Trauma Activations and provides guidance regarding medications, open fracture prophylaxis and tetanus booster • Provides management of airway packs and medication refills
Blood Bank
• Immediately runs TEG test when delivered to Blood Bank • Prepares Massive Blood Transfusion Chest
Forensic Nurse
• Respond to all Trauma 1 Team Activations • Examines patient and documents findings after primary and secondary survey are completed
Operating Room Charge Nurse

• Carries Trauma Activation pager and communicates with anesthesiologist in-charge • Discusses the requirements/set up for operative cases • Collaborates with Trauma Team to prepare room and activate on call team • Accepts report from the primary/scribe RN in the emergency department
